sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Tracts on the Saracens and Miscellaneous Texts
Tractatus de Mahometo, etc.
msDesc.p: Paper, 218 148 8.6 x 5.5, ff. 1 + 153, mostly 34-35 lines to a page. Cent. xv, clearly written in several hands.

I believe that the Ely cross which marks the Priory books has been torn out of the edge of f. 1r.
The flyleaf is of vellum and is the end of a deed (xiv early?) concerning the Priory (of Ely ?) and the Hospitallers (?). It has the handsome notarial mark of Will.de Beluero clericus Lincoln.dioc. Names of witnesses are given. Also a list of contents.
At the end of the volume, low down on the page, in large letters, is: Iste liber pertinet ecclesie eliensi (erased and revived).

msItem.head: Sarracenus (pseudo-al-Kindi), Epistola ad Christianum
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola sarraceni ad suam sectam christianum inuitantem (!)
msItem.incipit: In nomine dei misericordis et miseratoris adiutorium tuum o domine. Tempore abdalla helmemun fuit quidam de prudentissimis et excellentissimis elchesuu filii alahalet
msItem.explicit: scripsit itaque helesnimi christiano cartam cuius exemplar hoc est
msItem.rubric: Glosa
msItem.incipit: Sciendum quod ex quo sarraceni egiptum possiderunt ... omnes reges emur helimni [mo] (Emirhelmomini, C.C.C. Oxford) vocauerunt
msItem.explicit: Azoara. i. capitulum siue oraculum dicitur arabice
msItem.incipit: A quodam filio cuiusdam ad quendam filium cuiusdam Christianum salus super se et misericordia dei scriptum meum tibi cum pace
msItem.explicit: Placida et spontanea voluntate ad ea que nostra sunt venias exhortamur. vale
msItem.rubric: Explicit epistola sarraceni inuitantis ad sectam suam
msItem.ab: Items 1, 2 are in MS. C.C.C. Oxford 184, art. 6, 7 (of cent. xiv early)

head.title: Response of a Christian to the letters of the Saracen

msItem.rubric: Rescriptum Christiani ad maurum suam legem nichil esse merito rationis ostendentis
msItem.incipit: In nomine dei patris et filii et spiritu sancti misericordis et miseratoris ad quendam filium cuiusdam quidam filius cuiusdam christianus minimus seruorum Christi salus a deo salus et pietas et clemencia etc. ... vidi literas tuas et gratias egi deo
msItem.explicit: et aliquam facere utilitatem hominibus
msItem.incipit: Cum vero peruenissent iste due epistole ad emurhelmomini elmenu
msItem.explicit: oraciones dei super eum. sit nobis deus adiutor et protector et procurator benignus in omnibus. amen
msItem.ab: Items 1, 2 are in MS. C.C.C. Oxford 184, art. 6, 7 (of cent. xiv early)

msItem.head: Peter the Venerable OSB, Epistola ad Bernardum Claravallensem de impia secta Muhamet
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola domini Petri venerabili cluniacensis abbatis ad dominum Bernardum Clareuallensem abbatem de impia secta mahumet pseudoprophete
msItem.incipit: Singulari ueneracione colendo
msItem.explicit: gazis uestre sapiencie suppleat
msItem.rubric: Explicit epistola

msItem.head: Peter the Venerable OSB, Summa totius haeresis Sarracenorum
msItem.rubric: Incipit vita mahumet
msItem.incipit: Summa tocius heresis ac diabolice secte
msItem.rubric: Prologus Roberti translatoris uiri eruditi et scolastici ad dominum Petrum abbatem
msItem.incipit: Cum iubendi religio parendique votum
msItem.explicit: cedere affirmat

msItem.head: Robert Ketton, Chronica mendosa Sarracenorum (transl. by Hermann of Carinthia)
msItem.rubric: Cronica mendosa et ridiculosa sarracenorum
msItem.incipit: In creacionis sue primordio
msItem.explicit: die 10 almuharan

msItem.head: Hermann of Carinthia (attrib.), De generatione Mahumet et nutritura eius
msItem.rubric: De generacione mahumet et nutritura eius. quod transtulit hermanus sclauus scolasticus subtilis et ingeniosus apud legionem hispanie ciuitatem
msItem.incipit: Liber generacionis mahumet nuncii dei
msItem.explicit: cum gratiarum accione rediui

msItem.head: Hermann of Carinthia (attrib.), De doctrina Mahumet
msItem.rubric: De doctrina mahumet que apud sarracenos magne auctoritatis est sub eodem hermanno translata cum esset peritissimus utriusque lingue. scilicet latine et arabice
msItem.incipit: Erat nuncius dei oracio dei super eum et salus sedens inter socios in ciuitate sua Jesrab et descendit super eum angelus gabriel
msItem.explicit: cuius vere tu nuncius et propheta

msItem.head: Robert Ketton, Preface to the Liber legis Saracenorum quem Alchoran uocant
msItem.rubric: Prefacio Roberti translatoris ad dominum petrum cluniacensem abbatem in libro legis sarracenorum quem mahumet pseudopropheta per angelum gabrielem quasi de celo sibi missa confinxit
msItem.incipit: Domino suo petro
msItem.explicit: necessariis argumentis insistens

msItem.head: Riccoldus de Monte Crucis OP, Libellus contra legem Sarracenorum
msItem.rubric: Incipit libellus fratris Ricculdi ordinis predicatorum contra legem sarracenorum prohemium
msItem.incipit: Quot sunt dies serui tui
Primo igitur oportet scire qui sunt principales errores
msItem.explicit: lex adeo sanctissima pariter et obseruabilis mundo
msItem.rubric: Explicit

msItem.head: Vincent of Beauvais OP, Speculum historiale (extract from book 25, 118-45)
msItem.rubric: De conuersione Petri Alfunsi quondam Iudei et edicione libri sui auctor est (?)
msItem.incipit: Eo tempore petrus alfunsus quondam iudeus et moyses appellatum iudaismum reliquit
msItem.explicit: quam cepi legem implere perficiat. Amen. Hec vincencius in speculo libro 26 in fine eiusdem libri

ab.supplied: In fact, the modern literature says book 25

msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus de dungionibus (i. domibus) diaboli
msItem.incipit: Milicia est vita hominis super terram
msItem.explicit: ad rectam voluntatem penitendi valeat reuocari

msItem.head: pseudo-Bonaventure OFM, Sermo de modo uiuendi
msItem.rubric: Sermo de modo uiuendi fratri bonauenture
msItem.incipit: Quisquis es qui per fidem spem et caritatem
msItem.explicit: uideatur deus per gloriam ad quam nos perducat. amen

msItem.ab: One on the development of the embryo
msItem.incipit: Reuerendi domini legius dominus noster rex considerans dissenciones et discordias quas habemus ab intrinseco
msItem.ab: quotes the Policraticus and Aristotle: on f. 125r is an allusion to the Scotch as rebels
msItem.incipit: Ponans visitacionem tuam pacem. ps. 60. Amantissimi fratres mei ratione triplici visitacio ordinatur

head.title: Treatise on birds, fish, marvels and animals

msItem.ab: naciones morsibus impugnant. Sunt autem magnitudine cignorum colore ... griphes. onocraculus ... sirenes etc.

Mirabilia. Hec predicta que partim ex historiis orientalium mappa mundi partim ex scriptis beati Augustini, ysidori, et ex libris etiam plinii et solini ... Ciclopes. Pigmei. Gigantes. Barnacle-geese etc.
Instinct of animals. More about birds, ending
msItem.explicit: Cignus ... cantum suum ad modum cithare aptat
msItem.rubric: Explicit. Amen

msItem.incipit: Diccio gallice dictata debet regulariter secundum quod scribitur pronunciari
msItem.explicit: differencia est in gallicis inter mound scriptum per d. et mount scriptum per t. Regulariter omnis diccio debet scribi secundum quod pronunciatur

head.title: De septem signis in Christi natiuitate

msItem.rubric: De 7 signis in Christi natiuitate
msItem.incipit: Primum signum natiuitatis Christi fuit quod princeps unus id est cesar augustus per omnem orbem regnabat
msItem.ab: 2nd Peace, 3rd Census, 4th Death of 1030 slaves who would not return to their proper masters, 5th Star, 6th Perihelion, 7th Fount of oil at Rome

msItem.rubric: Nomina lapidum
msItem.incipit: Iaspis primus ponitur in fundamento ciuitatis dei. qui talem naturam habet
msItem.explicit: sed quasi vinum rubens apparens
msItem.rubric: Explicit de XII lapidibus
Regula et vita fratrum minorum hoc est silicet domini nostri Ihesu Christi sanctum euangelium obseruare viuendo in obediencia sine proprio voluntate et castitate
msItem.incipit: Frater franciscus promittit obedienciam etc. ... Si qui voluerit istam vitam accipere
msItem.explicit: que firmiter promisimus obseruemus
msItem.rubric: Explicit regula fratrum minorum

head.title: Tracts on diet in French and Latin (Prognostications)
On diet, regimen and weather during the twelve months, in French

msItem.incipit: Le meys de Januer appellent les astronomienz entendement cil apreygnent coment lem dyst le cors grarder
msItem.explicit: mort de prince ou de roy ou de counte ou de altre grant gentz
msItem.rubric: Hic incipit Idoneus Tractatus
msItem.incipit: Mense Januarii vinum album ieiunus bibe
msItem.rubric: Sequitur Rubrica de accionibus
msItem.ab: Receipts in French and Latin, headed Wills de haneworth iuxta Disce mark(et ?)

head.title: Documents relating to Roger Raude of Kenynghale and Robert Longham

msItem.ab: 2. 1387 at Trinity Hall. Rob. Longham, vicar of St John's, Maddermarket (Norwich)
On f. 144v begin a series of Formulae: on f. 150r one relating to Hauxton and Shelford
On f. 153r a deed of 138.. relating to Lopham, ending: in le bordenhostel Cantabr.
Partial list of contents on f. 153v
